definition: A fruit that is typically red, green, or yellow.
A long curved fruit with a yellow skin.
A small domesticated carnivorous mammal with soft fur.
A domesticated carnivorous mammal that typically has a long snout.
A large herbivorous mammal with a trunk.
A limbless cold-blooded vertebrate animal with gills and fins.
A small round or oval fruit used to make wine.
A building for human habitation.
Frozen water, a brittle transparent crystalline solid.
An area of land overgrown with dense forest and tangled vegetation.
A toy consisting of a light frame with thin material stretched over it.
A large tawny-colored cat that lives in prides.
A small to medium-sized primate that typically has a long tail.
A small book with blank or ruled pages for writing notes.
A round juicy citrus fruit with a tough bright reddish-yellow rind.
An instrument for writing or drawing, consisting of a thin stick of graphite.
The female ruler of an independent state.
A burrowing, plant-eating mammal with long ears.
The star around which the earth orbits.
A woody perennial plant, typically having a single stem or trunk.
A device for protection against the rain or sun.
A string instrument played with a bow.
A very large marine mammal with a streamlined hairless body.
A musical instrument played by striking a row of wooden bars.
A semi-solid sourish food prepared from milk fermented by added bacteria.
An African wild horse with black-and-white stripes.
A set of written or printed pages bound together.
A road vehicle, typically with four wheels, powered by an engine.
A hinged, sliding, or revolving barrier at the entrance to a building.
An oval or round object laid by a female bird, reptile, fish, or invertebrate.
The seed-bearing part of a plant, consisting of reproductive organs.
A hard, brittle substance typically transparent or translucent.
A shaped covering for the head worn for warmth or fashion.
A colored fluid used for writing, drawing, printing, or duplicating.
An outer garment extending either to the waist or the hips.
A small piece of shaped metal used to operate a lock.
A device for giving light.
A reflective surface, typically of glass coated with a metal amalgam.
A structure built by birds or other animals to hold eggs or young.
A very large expanse of sea.
An instrument for writing or drawing with ink.
A warm bed covering made of padding enclosed between layers of fabric.
A wide way leading from one place to another.
A fixed luminous point in the night sky.
A piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs.
A decorative container used to hold cut flowers.
An opening in the wall or roof of a building fitted with glass.
A piece of enclosed ground adjoining a building.
A fastening device consisting of two flexible strips of metal or plastic.
